intro: Schrankia nova, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Schrankia nova is often found in wetland and coastal environments, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
